meanings.definition: To pursue in order to catch or overtake.
meanings.sent1: The dog will chace the cat around the yard.
meanings.sent2: I chace after my little brother when we play tag.
meanings.sent3: The children love to chace each other in a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: She chaced her dreams with determination and never gave up.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's speed allowed it to chace down its prey effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The chace for the hidden treasure was thrilling.
meanings.sent2: The fox led the hounds on a wild chace through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The chace for the last piece of cake at the party was intense.
meanings.sent4: Life is a chace filled with unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The chace for knowledge led him to explore new horizons.
